thread.title: Japan's PM, unopposed, renamed party leader
thread.title_full: Japan's PM, unopposed, renamed party leader | News24

author: news24.com
title: Japan's PM, unopposed, renamed party leader
text:
Tokyo - Japanese Prime Minister Shinzo Abe won a new term as president of the ruling Liberal Democratic Party on Tuesday after facing no opposition for the job.
He told reporters afterward that he would push his ongoing economic revival plan, saying "Abenomics is still partway through."
The party named Abe president after no other lawmakers filed applications to run against him in an election that had been set for 20 September. Candidates had to gain support from 20 other lawmakers in the party to run.
Abe's current, three-year term as LDP president ends on 30 September His new term will run until 30 September, 2018.
